MemberSignature.Value: public int CompareTo (string string);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 CompareTo(string string) cil managed

Docs.summary: Compares this string to the given string.

remarks.para: Compares this string to the given string.
The strings are compared one char at a time. In the discussion of the return value below, note that char does not mean code point, though this should only be visible for surrogate pairs.

If there is an index at which the two strings differ, the result is the difference between the two chars at the lowest such index. If not, but the lengths of the strings differ, the result is the difference between the two strings' lengths. If the strings are the same length and every char is the same, the result is 0.

MemberSignature.Value: public int CompareToIgnoreCase (string string);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 CompareToIgnoreCase(string string) cil managed

Docs.summary: Compares this string to the given string, ignoring case differences.

remarks.para: Compares this string to the given string, ignoring case differences.
The strings are compared one char at a time. This is not suitable for case-insensitive string comparison for all locales. Use a instead.

If there is an index at which the two strings differ, the result is the difference between the two chars at the lowest such index. If not, but the lengths of the strings differ, the result is the difference between the two strings' lengths. If the strings are the same length and every char is the same, the result is 0.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Intern ();
.method public hidebysig instance string Intern() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an interned string equal to this string.

remarks.para: Returns an interned string equal to this string. The VM maintains an internal set of unique strings. All string literals found in loaded classes' constant pools are automatically interned. Manually-interned strings are only weakly referenced, so calling intern won't lead to unwanted retention.
Interning is typically used because it guarantees that for interned strings a and b, a.equals(b) can be simplified to a == b. (This is not true of non-interned strings.)
Many applications find it simpler and more convenient to use an explicit to implement their own pools.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Matches (string regularExpression);
.method public hidebysig instance bool Matches(string regularExpression) cil managed

Docs.summary: Tests whether this string matches the given regularExpression.

remarks.para: Tests whether this string matches the given regularExpression. This method returns true only if the regular expression matches the entire input string. A common mistake is to assume that this method behaves like ; if you want to match anywhere within the input string, you need to add .* to the beginning and end of your regular expression. See .
If the same regular expression is to be used for multiple operations, it may be more efficient to reuse a compiled Pattern.

exception.cref: !:NoType:if the syntax of the supplied regular expression is not valid.

Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

.method public hidebysig instance char[] ToCharArray() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a new char array containing a copy of the chars in this string.

remarks.para: Returns a new char array containing a copy of the chars in this string. This is expensive and rarely useful. If you just want to iterate over the chars in the string, use instead.

MemberSignature.Value: public string ToLowerCase ();
.method public hidebysig instance string ToLowerCase() cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts this string to lower case, using the rules of the user's default locale.

remarks.para: Converts this string to lower case, using the rules of the user's default locale. See "Be wary of the default locale".

MemberSignature.Value: public string ToLowerCase (Java.Util.Locale locale);
.method public hidebysig instance string ToLowerCase(class Java.Util.Locale locale) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts this string to lower case, using the rules of locale.

remarks.para: Converts this string to lower case, using the rules of locale.

Most case mappings are unaffected by the language of a Locale. Exceptions include dotted and dotless I in Azeri and Turkish locales, and dotted and dotless I and J in Lithuanian locales. On the other hand, it isn't necessary to provide a Greek locale to get correct case mapping of Greek characters: any locale will do.
See for full details of context- and language-specific special cases.

Docs.summary: To be added.

Docs.summary: Converts this this string to upper case, using the rules of locale.

remarks.para: Converts this this string to upper case, using the rules of locale.

Most case mappings are unaffected by the language of a Locale. Exceptions include dotted and dotless I in Azeri and Turkish locales, and dotted and dotless I and J in Lithuanian locales. On the other hand, it isn't necessary to provide a Greek locale to get correct case mapping of Greek characters: any locale will do.
See for full details of context- and language-specific special cases.

Docs.summary: Returns a string with no code points <= \\u0020 at the beginning or end.

remarks.para: Returns a string with no code points <= \\u0020 at the beginning or end.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string ValueOf (Java.Lang.Object value);
.method public static hidebysig string ValueOf(class Java.Lang.Object value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts the specified object to its string representation.

remarks.para: Converts the specified object to its string representation. If the object is null return the string "null", otherwise use toString() to get the string representation.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string ValueOf (bool value);
.method public static hidebysig string ValueOf(bool value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts the specified boolean to its string representation.

remarks.para: Converts the specified boolean to its string representation. When the boolean is true return "true", otherwise return "false".

MemberSignature.Value: public static string ValueOf (char value);
.method public static hidebysig string ValueOf(char value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a new string of just the given char.

remarks.para: Returns a new string of just the given char.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string ValueOf (char[] data);
.method public static hidebysig string ValueOf(char[] data) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a new string containing the same chars as the given array.

remarks.para: Returns a new string containing the same chars as the given array. Modifying the array after creating the string has no effect on the string.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string ValueOf (char[] data, int start, int length);
.method public static hidebysig string ValueOf(char[] data, int32 start, int32 length) cil managed

Docs.param: the starting offset in the character array.
the number of characters to use.
Docs.summary: Returns a new string containing the same chars as the given subset of the given array.

remarks.para: Returns a new string containing the same chars as the given subset of the given array. Modifying the array after creating the string has no effect on the string.

Docs.exception: if length , start or start + length > data.length
